title: Banana Oatmeal Recipe for Breakfast, Caramelized Banana Oats Recipe
content:
Recently I have been having oatmeal in my breakfast a lot. I try to add some fruits into the oatmeal and make it more tasty and enjoyable. This is one recipe that I made yesterday and loved it, so with no more delay I am sharing it.

I used some ripe bananas and for sweetener, I used jaggery in this. You can add brown sugar or honey for sweetener. Stay tuned I will be sharing much more oatmeal recipes soon.

 

Preparation Time: 5 mins

Cooking Time: 10 mins

Serves: 2

 

Ingredients:

Regular Milk or Soy Milk – 2 cup

Instant Quick Cooking Oats – 1/2 cup

Cinnamon – 1/2 tsp

Brown Sugar or Jaggery – 1 tablespoon or to taste

 

For Topping:

Ripe Banana – 1 sliced

Brown Sugar / Jaggery – 1 tablespoon

Butter – 1 tsp

 

Method:

 

Start by making the caramel. Heat butter in a pan, add in sliced bananas and brown sugar and saute till for 3 to 4 mins till caramelized. Remove this to a bowl and set aside.

Now in the same pan, add in oats, soy milk, cinnamon, and brown sugar and mix well. Cook till oats are done. 

Now spoon this into a bowl and top with bananas. Serve.

recommendations.title: Avocado Puree Recipe for Babies ( Mashed Avocado )
recommendations.content: Avocado is a great first food for babies. You can start feeding it as soon as your baby starts their solids. Since it is easy to digest, they are great weaning food. Avocado is rich in omega 3 which helps in brain development in babies. You can add some banana to this puree, it adds potassium too

recommendations.title: Sooji Potato Pancakes Recipe, Finger Food Recipes for Toddlers and Babies
recommendations.content: This is one recipe that I came up with when I wanted to feed my little one with some snacks in the evening. I had a boiled potato on hand, so I added some sooji and made it into the pancake. It turned out so soft, so it will be easy for your little one to chew. Plus it is so tasty.
